item.title: Kuroshio Extension Mooring System (KEMS)
item.description: Kuroshio Extension Mooring System (KEMS) The Kuroshio Extension (KE) in the Northwest Pacific Ocean is one of the most dynamically-complex regions in the global ocean, but is one of the regions with the least long-term continuous observations. Since 2014, Ocean University of China has started the construction of Kuroshio Extension observation system and carried out a series of far-reaching scientific-research-oriented in-situ observational experiments. In 2020, the phase I of the Kuroshio Extension Mooring System (KEMS) has been successfully constructed, providing real-time hydrological and meteorological data.

item.title: Research and Scientific Applications of New Observation Platforms
